results.title: An Interview with Phil Bailey
results.brief_description: Phil Bailey was a telegrapher - one of a unique cohort of women who were trained in signalling by a forward-thinking female engineer. She has never forgotten morse code due to the wise words of her teacher.
results.description: Phil Bailey was a telegrapher - one of a unique cohort of women who were trained in signalling by a forward-thinking female engineer. She has never forgotten morse code due to the wise words of her teacher.

results.title: An Interview with Peter Isaacson : pathfinder
results.creator_credit: Peter Isaacson and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Peter Isaacson tells his story of joining the Air Force in World War II and becoming part of the legendary Pathfinders. Peter also became famous for flying under the Sydney Harbour Bridge towards the end of World War II.

results.title: An Interview with Peter Clemence
results.brief_description: Peter Clemence tells us his experience in the Royal Australian Air Force at the end of the Second World War, his experiences flying scientists in Antarctica in the 1950’s and his adventures flying helicopters during the mining exploration era. He also talks about Ash Wednesday and the collapse of the West Gate Bridge.
results.description: Peter Clemence tells us his experience in the Royal Australian Air Force at the end of the Second World War, his experiences flying scientists in Antarctica in the 1950’s and his adventures flying helicopters during the mining exploration era. He also talks about Ash Wednesday and the collapse of the West Gate Bridge.

He also talks about Ash Wednesday and the collapse of the West Gate Bridge.

results.title: An Interview with Pat Vines: The Shrine of Remembrance
results.creator_credit: Pat Vines and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: After Pat Vines returns from the war as a Commander of the Australian Navy, one of her senior navy officers recommends her to the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees, which she joins. She tells of her time as a Trustee for the Shrine.

results.title: An Interview with Pat Vines
results.creator_credit: Pat Vines and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Pat Vines joined the Australian Navy as a nurse during World War II. She moved up the ranks and eventually became a Commander. Pat tells her story through her memories of wartime and what it was like to work in the Navy.
results.description: Pat Vines joined the Australian Navy as a nurse during World War II. She moved up the ranks and eventually became a Commander. Pat tells her story through her memories of wartime and what it was like to work in the Navy.

results.title: An Interview with Norm Smithells
results.creator_credit: Norm Smithells and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Norm Smithells was a Spitfire pilot in Europe during World War II. He reflects on flying and fighting the Germans during this time and shares his history as there are not many pilots left.

results.title: An Interview with May Gibbs
results.brief_description: In 1968 Hazel de Berg interviewed Australia’s most loved storyteller, May Gibbs, the creator of Snugglepot and Cuddlepie and all the bush folk. During the video, you will hear May Gibbs (Mrs. Ossoli Kelly) tell of her birth in 1877 in Surrey, England, her trip to Australia in 1881, her family’s settlement in Western Australia and her adventures in the art schools of London. She speaks of her love of the Australian bush, her development as an artist and reveals the creation of the Gumnuts and all their friends and foes.
results.description: In 1968 Hazel de Berg interviewed Australia’s most loved storyteller, May Gibbs, the creator of Snugglepot and Cuddlepie and all the bush folk. During the video, you will hear May Gibbs (Mrs. Ossoli Kelly) tell of her birth in 1877 in Surrey, England, her trip to Australia in 1881, her family’s settlement in Western Australia and her adventures in the art schools of London. She speaks of her love of the Australian bush, her development as an artist and reveals the creation of the Gumnuts and all their friends and foes.
description_for_label: In 1968 Hazel de Berg interviewed Australia’s most loved storyteller, May Gibbs, the creator of Snugglepot and Cuddlepie and all the bush folk. During the video, you will hear May Gibbs (Mrs. Ossoli Kelly) tell of her birth in 1877 in Surrey, England, her trip to Australia in 1881, her family’s settlement in Western Australia and her adventures in the art schools of London. She speaks of her love of the Australian bush, her development as an artist and reveals the creation of the Gumnuts and all their friends and foes.

results.title: An Interview with Major General Jim Hughes
results.brief_description: Major General Jim Hughes joined the army just after World War II. Army life suited him and he served as a platoon commander in Korea in the 1950s. He details one particularly long Sunday, during this time, when his company was ambushed by the Chinese and resulted in him maturing considerably in one day.
results.title_for_label: An Interview with Major General Jim Hughes
results.description: Major General Jim Hughes joined the army just after World War II. Army life suited him and he served as a platoon commander in Korea in the 1950s. He details one particularly long Sunday, during this time, when his company was ambushed by the Chinese and resulted in him maturing considerably in one day.

results.title: An Interview with Laurie Price
results.creator_credit: Laurie Price, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Laurie Price is one of the remaining third of those Australians who served in Korea. He provides sharp detail of the work he performed there on the airfields, the distractions and tensions, even between allies. While the war is long over, it continues to affect Price even today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurie Price, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: An Interview with Joyce Bryan
results.brief_description: Joyce Bryan was a witness to the return of the Prisoners of War from Japan. She provides an powerful and detailed rendering of the emotionally charged return and the struggles of the men to fit back into society.
